result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on January 10, 2022.
Hearing on January 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcelino Robles
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-10-2022)
Prior: 705 Briar Hill Dr, Waukesha, WI 53188

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A, B, & C (or thier residences) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  The Defendant is to turn over all firearms to the Waukesha County Sheiff's Department within 24 hours of being released.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victims A, B, & C, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.   Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victims A, B, & C listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.

02:13 PM Defendant Marcelino Robles in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
